total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the pattern in the transformation from the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that the output grid is a 6x6 grid, three times the size of the input grid.
Q3: Observe that the first two rows of the output grid are repetitions of the input grid's rows.
Q4: Notice that the next two rows of the output grid are repetitions of the input grid's rows but with the numbers in each pair swapped.
Q5: Observe that the last two rows of the output grid are repetitions of the input grid's rows again.
Q6: Apply this pattern to the input grid in the quiz to generate the output grid.
Q1: Identify the pattern in the transformation from the input grid to the output grid in the examples.
Q2: Notice that the output grid is a 6x6 grid, which is three times the size of the input grid in both dimensions.
Q3: Observe that the output grid is composed of the input grid repeated three times horizontally.
Q4: Also, notice that every third row in the output grid is a mirrored version of the corresponding row in the input grid.
Q5: Apply the same pattern to the input grid of the quiz to generate the output grid.

Q6: Apply these observations to transform the input grid of the quiz into the output grid.
